intro: Palicourea ponasae, commonly known as the Panamá moonseed, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Panama, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in cymes. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
